events.name: Front End TL;DR
events.description: Have you ever come across something new in front end, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Front End TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at the venue host ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks7:15pm — Intro talk by the host7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned9:30–10:00pm — The end. There should be guest wifi. Food & drinks provided (ymmv). Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/

events.name: WordPress Meetup (Nov 2015)
events.description: The WordPress Singapore meetup aims to bring together people of all skill levels, from beginners to people who have been using WordPress since it was first released in 2003 (woah!). This month's meetup is about WooCommerce and <second talk to be determined>. Tuan Bui - WooRocketsWooCommerce ecosystem and things around it. Let's talkA two-way sharing on WooCommerce ecosystem: themes, plugins, services providers, people, groups related to WooCommerce both social and offline- Level: Beginner/Intermediate - This is a sharing session. Any amount of knowledge from the audience is welcome. Robert Sim - WordPress developer, Web AnalyticsQuick Talk: WordPress 4.4 Field GuideA quick peak at some of the new features for WordPress 4.4 such as being oEmbed provider, meta tags.- Level: Intermediate Quick Talk: Putting Ads on WordPressA quick intro on putting advertisement on WordPress.- Level: Beginner Open space discussion We're looking for speakers and volunteers to help organise our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore
